title: Gear review: Eddie Bauer Daisy Wrap
text:
Gear review: Eddie Bauer Daisy Wrap 1 / 1 gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6484475|article-gallery-6484475|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6484475|article-gallery-6484475|0 
The best items of clothing for travel seem to contain a special magic: They can be worn over and over, paired with different outfits, and always work without people noticing that you’re wearing them multiple times. The Eddie Bauer Daisy Wrap fits into that category. The soft and lightweight wrap contains fabric that allows for some stretch, and also wicks moisture for comfort. The polyester/Tencel lyocell/spandex blend is wrinkle resistant, which means you can roll or fold it with abandon, as well as avoid the hotel room iron. It’s easy to toss in the washing machine or your hotel room sink, and dries relatively quickly. Wear it on city streets, to yoga class, out to dinner, on the airplane, or even as a beach cover-up, and you’re set. 
What we liked: The lightweight wrap works easily for destinations with temperatures that range from the Bay Area to Caribbean. It’s less likely to snag than some of its similar-weight competitors. 
Not so much: The draped-front style may not work for everyone. I’ve seen someone tie it, and that’s that. 
Vitals: Eddie Bauer Daisy Wrap, $60 from www.eddiebauer.com.
